org.casa.synthproxy

Class Command

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.casa.synthproxy.Command

  • public class Command
extends Object
    This class maps a command in CASA system. It uses the same envelope as BitVoicer commands.
    Author:
    Daniel Parra Tucunduva

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private long activatedUntil 
      private byte commandTp 
      private String data 
      private String svoice 
      static byte TP_CHECK
      CHECK Command - This command will query CASAActuator for its status - if command issuing is enabled or not
      static byte TP_ENABLE
      ENABLE Command - This is a special command that will tell the system that an actual command will be triggered soon.
      static byte TP_SHUTDOWN
      SHUTDOWN Command - sent to tell that the connection will be shut down
      static byte TP_STATUS
      STATUS Command - sent to tell that a connection is starting or being closed
      static byte TP_STRING
      STRING Command - This command type is the one that is used to send data to CASAActuator.

        See Also:

      • TP_ENABLE

        public static final byte TP_ENABLE
        ENABLE Command - This is a special command that will tell the system that an actual command will be triggered soon. STRING commands are executed only during an activation period
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TP_CHECK

        public static final byte TP_CHECK
        CHECK Command - This command will query CASAActuator for its status - if command issuing is enabled or not
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TP_STRING

        public static final byte TP_STRING
        STRING Command - This command type is the one that is used to send data to CASAActuator. This is the type that contain the real commands, like changing the channel or turning the TV set on
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getData

        public String getData()
        Get command data
        Returns:
        command data

      • setData

        public Command setData(String data)
        Set command data. IF the content contains a semi-coma, it is split in two. The first part is the actual data, that will be sent to CASAActuator. The second part is the text that will be synthetized. This allows you to configure external agents like bitvoicer to send both command data and voice feedback.
        Parameters:
        data - command data
        Returns:
        this very same object

      • getActivatedUntil

        public long getActivatedUntil()
        Get activation period in miliseconds
        Returns:
        activation period in miliseconds

        Set activation period in miliseconds
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Set text that will synthetized
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        this very same object

      • toBytes

        public byte[] toBytes(boolean includeTTS)
        Retrieve a byte array representing this command. This byte array is the one to be sent to CASAActuator though COM port.
        Parameters:
        includeTTS - Boolean flag to tell this method if the voice part should be included. When sending command to CASAActuator, because of package size limitations, it is a good idea to exclude voice information as it is not relevant to CASAActuator.
        Returns:
        Byte array representation of this command

      • splitCommand

        public List<Command> splitCommand()
        Split this command in several other commands, if relevant. A command can represent several other commands if the DATA part is composed of several command put together with a "#" as separator. If this is the case, this method will split this command into several other commands and return this list. If the command is actually a single one, it will be the only element in the return list.
        Returns:
        Command list

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
